resources.string:
Thanks for downloading Shuffle.

 New in this version:
 	• Translation fixes
 
 New in version 3.0.0:
 	• Push sync with brand new www.shuffle.co website
 	• New design including 1st class tablet support
 
 
 New in version 2.0.1:
 	• Prevent soft keyboard popping up
 	• Android 2.1 compatibility
 
 New in version 2.0.0:
 	• Complete UI rewrite
 	• Full ICS compatibility
 	• Support for multiple contexts per action
 	• Context and project specific widgets and shortcuts
 	• Swipe to navigate between views
 	• New widget look (scrollable on ICS)
 	• Multi-select operations on action lists
 	• Quick add bar for actions, contexts and projects
 	• Default context applied more consistently
 	• Updated help screens
 	• Fixed issues with search
 	• Ability to filter by project or context on any view
 	• More and higher resolution context icons
 	• New Custom action view (set it up however you want)
 	• Minor Tracks fixes
 
 New in version 1.7.3:
 	• Fixed restore from backup bug
 
 New in version 1.7.2:
 	• Fixed dates when viewing Google calendar entries
 	• Improved Japanese translation
 	• Added Dutch translation
 
 New in version 1.7.1:
 	• Fixed crash creating new actions in Spanish version
 	• Ignore deleted items calculating Next Actions
 
 New in version 1.7.0:
 	• View filters, customisable in each view.
 	• Active flags on contexts and projects.
 	• Deleted items are now recoverable.
 	• Toolbar added to list views.
 	• New 4x4 widget.
 	• Tickler view for inactive actions.
 	• Support for Tracks sites with self signed certificates.
 	• Fixed calendar selection bug on Android 2.2.
 	• Fixed action reordering in projects and Next Actions.
 	• Action view screen added.
 	• Spanish, Portugese and Japanese translations.
 
 
 Also note that this application sends anonymous usage statistics back to a server. If you'd rather not allow that, you can turn it off under Settings.
Add dates to enable this option
New entry will load after saving
Updated entry will load after saving
Anonymous data is used for finding bugs and prioritizing features.

To enable synchronization you need to select the Google account you use to login to www.shuffle.co

No Google accounts setup. Add one?
There are no actions to display. Get started by selecting \"Add Action\" from the menu.
There are no projects to display. Get started by creating actions in the Inbox and assigning them to projects.
There are no tags to display. Get started by creating actions in the Inbox and assigning them to tags.
Are you sure you want to delete the selected %1$s and it\'s %2$d %3$s(s)?
Delete all actions, projects and custom tags?
Deleted all actions, projects and custom tags.

Welcome to Shuffle, a \"Getting Things Done\" inspired personal organization tool. If you want to see how best to use Shuffle, click \"Demonstration\" to load up a bunch of example projects and actions. Later you can start again by selecting \"Delete all\" from the Settings menu.
Or get stuck in straight away with no actions or projects and only the default set of tags...
See Help menu for additional instructions and tips.

Shuffle is a \"Getting Things Done\" inspired personal organization tool. It lets you quickly enter and categorize \'actions\'. With many different views, you can attack your actions any way you please. \n A simple elegant workflow encourages you to categorize your actions into projects and tags. This structure lets you to break down formidable projects into individual achievable tasks.\n As a project evolves, clean out old actions as they\'re performed, add new actions and reorder any remaining actions depending on your current priorities.

This is the best place to add your actions. The Inbox is where all actions start off before they are processed. Try to regularly scan the Inbox, analyzing each action and either discard it, do it or assign it to a project and/or one or more tags.\n Once a project or tag is assigned to an action, it will automatically be removed from the Inbox.

The Project perspective lists all your projects, and allows you to drill-down into each project to view its actions. In addition to the standard adding, editing and deleting of actions, the project view also supports rearranging actions in the order you intend to complete them. This step is important for the Next Actions perspective.\n For some projects it makes sense for actions to completed one after the other in strict order. For other projects, actions can be completed in any order. This is configurable when creating or editing a project.

You may optionally assign one or more tags to each of your actions. They can be locations, categories or whatever makes sense to you. Shuffle comes with a few standard tags to get you started: At home, At work, Online, Errands, Contact and Read. \n Feel free to modify or delete the existing, or add your own tags that suit your situation.\n The tag view is especially useful when you\'re intending on getting something done, and need to see what actions are applicable to your current situation. For instance, you\'re out and about in town, so you check your Errands tag and see you need to buy an umbrella and pick up the dry cleaning on your way home.

Next actions is the best place to look to determine what the next thing this to work on is. 
 It shows the following actions
 - those without a project
 - the first action for sequential projects
 - all actions for parallel projects
 This list quickly shows you the most important actions for you to get started on now.

Due actions lets you keep track of actions you have given an explicit due date. There are 3 views - Today, This Week and This Month each showing actions due for the given time scale. Overdue actions are shown in all views.

A number of aspects of Shuffle are user-configurable. The Settings screen is available from all views via the menu. 
 Calendar - Select a calendar to use when integrating actions with Google Calendar. 
 Synchronize Settings - Configure a website you'd like your data to be synchronized with. 
 Backup to SD Card - Save all your actions, tags and projects to your SD Card. You can them back this up to your computer. 
 Restore from SD Card - Restores all your data from a backup. No attempt is made to avoid duplicate actions, so it's best to restore onto a clean Shuffle instance. 
 Delete completed actions - Permanently delete all completed actions. 
 Delete everything! - Permanently delete all actions, projects and custom tags.

Some handy Shuffle features you may not know about:
 1) In almost all views, swipe left or right to navigate between similar views.
 2) All lists have View Settings to let you pick exactly what you want to see. For instance whether to show completed or deleted actions.
 3) Enabled the Quick Add Bar via View Settings on any view to quickly add actions, projects and tags in place.
 4) Hitting the Back button saves before closing.
 5) Create shortcuts on your Home Screens for various Shuffle views and actions
 6) Add a widget to your Home Screen to get a quick view on any list
 7) In Global Settings > Search, enable Shuffle for actions to appear in Quick Search Box queries

Thanks to the team behind the Tango Desktop Project, an open source collection of icons used in Shuffle. Thanks also to David Gibb for providing some great feedback on the design, Morten Nielson for the Tracks synch work, and to Gudrun for tolerating my nights and weekends spent tinkering with Android.\n \n For feedback or bug reports, please check http://code.google.com/p/android-shuffle/issues/list or email me at andy@dodgybits.org
Custom by default shows all actions. Change the view settings to whatever you want to create your own personalized view.\n

Tickler shows actions you\'ve decided to delay for whatever reason. By default it includes actions that are set to start in the future. You can change this (via View Settings) to whatever you want. For instance, you may change it to show all inactive actions (actions assigned to inactive projects or tags).

Actions, projects and tags all have active and deleted flags. Additionally, actions have a completed flag.
 
 All entities are active by default. You may wish to make an entity inactive if you don't intend to tackle it any time soon. It still exists, but by default, you won't see it in your views.
 
 When you delete an entity, it is flagged as deleted internally and by default will not be visible in any views. You can restore an entity by changing your View Settings to show deleted items and editing the value. If you wish to permanently delete an entity, you can do so from the Settings menu.
 
 Actions pick up some of their state from the project and tags they are assigned to. An action is considered active if its project (if any) is active and at least one of its tags (if any) are active. An action is considered deleted if either it is marked as deleted or its project (if any) is deleted. When a tag is marked as deleted its association with all actions is removed. In other words, deleting a tag will never delete an action.
